intro: Ruellia perrieri, commonly known as the Perrier's ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of blue, purple, and white. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its blooming period extends from spring to early autumn, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Ruellia perrieri thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, preferring warm, humid climates.
